title: dr-autosync: dr tikvs hung  if primary tikvs startup again after do disaster recovery
body:
## Bug Report

<!-- Thanks for your bug report! Don't worry if you can't fill out all the sections. -->

### What version of TiKV are you using?
<!-- You can run `tikv-server --version` -->
sh-4.2# ./tikv-server -V
TiKV
Release Version:   6.0.0-alpha
Edition:           Community
Git Commit Hash:   f3a230996f4208948cf5e0a3d4e1583e388cdb6f
Git Commit Branch: heads/refs/tags/v6.1.0-alpha
UTC Build Time:    2022-03-26 14:55:51
Rust Version:      rustc 1.60.0-nightly (1e12aef3f 2022-02-13)
Enable Features:   jemalloc mem-profiling portable sse test-engines-rocksdb cloud-aws cloud-gcp cloud-azure
Profile:           dist_release

### What operating system and CPU are you using?
<!-- If you're using Linux, you can run `cat /proc/cpuinfo` -->

### Steps to reproduce
<!-- If possible, provide a recipe for reproducing the error. A complete runnable program is good. -->
STEP: Step 1: Init cluster
STEP: Step 1: Run workload
STEP: Step 2: Down dr cluster to block write
STEP: Step 3: Read data from primary cluster
STEP: Step 4: Down primary cluster and startup dr cluster
STEP: Step 5: Restore dr cluster
STEP: Step 6: Verify in dr cluster
STEP: Step 7: Startup primary cluster

### What did you expect?
After run step 7, dr cluster should works fine.
### What did happened?
After run step 7, dr tikvs don't work, report following error.

comments_data.body: The w/a is shutdown primary cluster, then dr cluster can works fine again.

@disksing 
Is this a blocking issue for release versions?
It's not a blocking issue. It cannot fix now because it is a foundamental design problem. We can only mention it in documents.

Can't reproduce in version v6.5.4ï¼Œ tpcc workload running stable after starting primary dc.
